page.title: 04Glenisla Church
page.content: Glenisla originally had two churches. The Free Church is no longer there and the present church was built in 1821 although there is mention of a church in Glenisla back in the 14th century. The church to_day is a very simple building with a seating capacity which has been reduced from the seven hundred seats when it was built to the present one hundred and seventy seats. There are seventy two members in the church. An average of only one wedding and one christening ceremony is held per year. The Church of Scotland minister travels to the three churches of Lintrathen, Kilry and Glenisla. There is a one hour service on a Sunday. There is a Woman's Guild and Sunday School for the children.
